body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following cannot be used to describe the word in the audio?
body.correct: Excellently done! 都 dōu means “both/all,” and it’s used to describe two or more persons or objects.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the audio again, think about its meaning, and the quantity it can be used to describe. You got this!

body.quiz: Which of the following cannot be used to describe the word in the audio?

body.correct: Fabulous job! 好笑 hǎoxiào means funny or comical. Of the four choices, the last image is the least likely funny or comical.
body.incorrect: So close! Listen again and identify the meaning of the word in the audio; then consider what kind of emotion it depicts.

body.textVersion: Audio for 漂亮 piàoliàng

body.quiz: Which of the following is the antonym of the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 丑 chǒu
options: Audio for 帅 shuài
Audio for 高 gāo
Audio for 矮 ǎi
body.correct: Outstanding job! 漂亮 piàoliàng means “pretty”; therefore, its antonym (opposite) is 丑 chǒu (ugly).
body.incorrect: Not quite… think about the meaning of the word in the audio and consider its antonym (word with opposite meaning).
